page.title: 10THE GEORGE AND DRAGON
page.content: There used to be six pubs in Hurstbourne Tarrant, but now there is only one, the George and Dragon which faces the crossroads. It was a coaching inn, and in the lounge bar, there is still evidence of this. A small{kneehole desk}which formed the parcels office faces the car park where the stables used to be. Parcels were handed in through the window. The{letter rack}(where both outgoing and incoming letters awaited collection) forms the mantleshelf of the inglenook fireplace. A small window facing the road was a bar for customers who stayed outside. The area around the window is shelved, and there is a bottle opener set into the frame A restaurant now occupies a room once used as a cycle shop.
